div.l: Ther͗e lyth on my vombe and on my hede
Help Symkyn the fals Clerkis fight
This Iohn stert vp as sone as evir͗e he myght
And graspid be the wallis to and fro
To fynd a staf and she stert vp also
And knewe the estis bet þan did þis Iohn
And by þe wal astaf she fond anon̄
And sy alitil shemeryng of a light
For atta ole in shone the mone light
And by that light she sawe hem both to
But sikirly she nyst who was whoo
"~" in left margin may be correction mark.And as she sawe a white in her ye
And when she gan the white thing aspy
She went the Clerkis had weryd a voluper͗e
And with the staf she drowe ay ner ⁊and nere
And went have hit this Aleyn̄ atte ful
And smote the Miller on the pillid skul
And down̄ he goith and cryd harowe I dy
These Clerkis bete hym̄ wele and lete hym ly
And gryndyn̄ hem̄ and toke her corn̄ anon̄
And eke her mele and on her wey þey goon̄
And atte Mil dor ȝit they toke her Cake
Of half a busshel flour͗e wel I bake
Thus is the proud Miller wel I bete
And hath I lost the gryndyng of his whete
And paid for the soper everydele
Of Aleyn̄ and Iohn that bete him wele
His wyfe is swyvid and his doghter als
Lo such it is a myller to be fals
And therfor þis proverb is ful soth
Hym þare nat wene wele þat evil doith
A giler shal evir begilid be
And God þat sitteth in mageste
Save al this company grete ⁊and smale
Thus have I quyt þe Miller in my tale
Here endith the Ryve his tale
